conclusion: Analyze how shadows change when light source moves directly above objects
Identify objects: cigarette pack, cigarette/pencil, egg/oval object, blue alarm clock, small dark object
Identify shadows labeled A, B, C, and D with red arrows
Shadow A is cast by the egg/oval object
Shadow A becomes smaller and directly beneath the egg when light is above
Shadow B is cast by the handle/top portion of the blue alarm clock
Shadow B merges with Shadow C when light is above, no longer projects outward
Shadow C is the main shadow of the blue alarm clock's body
Shadow C becomes smaller and directly beneath the clock when light is above
Shadow D is from a protruding part of the clock
Shadow D merges with Shadow C when light is above, no longer projects outward
All shadows move directly beneath their objects, become smaller, match bottom profiles, B and D merge with C
Final answer: Shadows change as predicted when light source moves directly above
Second image confirms shadows are smaller, directly beneath objects, B and D not visible separately
